docstr: `ADJUSTL` — Left adjust a string ### Description `ADJUSTL(STRING)` will left adjust a string by removing leading spaces. Spaces are inserted at the end of the string as needed. ### Syntax `RESULT = ADJUSTL(STRING)` ### Arguments . ### Return value The return value is of type `CHARACTER` and of the same kind as `STRING` where leading spaces are removed and the same number of spaces are inserted on the end of `STRING`. ### Example ``` program test_adjustl   character(len=20) :: str = ' gfortran'   str = adjustl(str)   print *, str end program test_adjustl ``` ### Standard Fortran 90 and later ### Class Elemental function ### See also ADJUSTR, TRIM
